column4: question - will Bad Things happen if I delete certain .list files in /var/lib/dpkg/info ?
I've had a spot of filesystem corruption leaving a bunch of them needing to be replaced, but dpkg won't work due to the files being the wrong format
If they do, that is what backups are for.
I don't have a backup of /var
bit of an oops on my part
Make one before you goof with it.
wedll, kind of goes without saying
I do not see as anything could really go bad, there is the restore function
I was just wondering if anyone actually knew before I tried it

But you never know, so back it up if you have data that you want saved, OSs crash, is normally user error, try this, copy the text from that command, save it, then edit the other, if goof ups happen, then replace the original configs
mmhm. ooh, it downgrades the problem from an error to a serious warning
OK, I can install stuff again now *phew*
